alert.note: Alert for Merced (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 28 at 8:49PM PDT until further notice by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in California... Merced River at Stevinson affecting Merced County. For the Merced River...including Stevinson...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Merced River at Stevinson. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...Impacts...At 65.0 feet, Hagaman Park along Highway 165 begins to flood. At 69.0 feet, The playground area in Hagaman Park along Highway 165 is flooded. At 70.5 feet, Water is up to the maintenance building in Hagaman Park. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM PDT Tuesday the stage was 71.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 PM PDT Tuesday was 71.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain steady above flood stage at 71.3 feet. - Flood stage is 71.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 70.5 feet on 03/21/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Location Fld Observed Forecasts (9 pm PDT) -------- Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Merced River Stevinson 71.0 71.2 Tue 8 pm PDT 71.3 71.3 71.3 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way. This warning will be in effect until the river falls below its flood stage. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning by 1000 AM PDT.
